BTW, you can download it in the usual way. I favor rakudobrew, so go with
rakudobrew build moar 2018.12
followed by rakudobrew build zef and rakudobrew global 2018.12. Packages for Linux flavors by @nxadm will be out soon, and my own Docker images too.
RT @smokemachine: A Red Secret Santa: https://t.co/Y3Umnrchqp
Where, by the way, @smokemachine talks today about, in the words of @scimon an ORM that doesn't make you want to be sick, RED: https://t.co/xikws30J4O Check it out! https://t.co/JgJtXiiUMb

#perl6 is an excellent language, and it keeps getting better. We are a small, but committed, community. If you want to check the language out, these dates are excellent for doing that by taking a look at the Advent Calendar https://t.co/n3jakfpTk5 https://t.co/ETg8LnrWke

The usual optimizations are also there: regex match is faster now, for instance. And lots of fixes. And some of them were done, on the fly, as an answer to a StackOverflow question https://t.co/ppyFZ6kCEM (by Lizmat, of course). https://t.co/mGFLGtykOU
(BTW, @loltimo and @jnthnwrthngtn are obviously two big contributors to this release, as usual) (sorry, I forgot) https://t.co/BXU95lBwNz

But one of the amazing additions, by Lizmat, is dealing with endianness at the language level. Plus she's also written the documentation for it https://t.co/vJ5ypDMSjT (this is not as usual as you would expect) https://t.co/LBXj7ayI5p
The main thing in this version is that the JavaScript backend, by Pawel Murias, keeps improving. It's been used already in the Advent Calendar entry by @gellyfish on cellular automata, for instance.

This is the second of the major version 6.d "Diwali", and there are lots of improvements added by the usual crew of volunteers, including @samcv6 , AlexDaniel, Niner, Tom Browder, ugexe, lizmat, and many others. https://t.co/SwKCZWnY15
In its usual understated way (just a new file in the repo), #perl6 2018.12, last one this year, is out: https://t.co/kBqFpqwEFG https://t.co/i6CRxIcOeW
